text: William Thomas Stead (5 July 1849 â€“ 15 April 1912) was a British writer and journalist. He was a pioneer of investigative journalism, and one of the most controversial figures in British journalism during the Victorian era. His death occurred during the sinking of RMS Titanic. == Other websites == *Encyclopedia Titanica: Biography of William Thomas Stead Category:English journalists Category:1849 births Category:1912 deaths Category:Victims of the RMS Titanic Category:Writers from Northumberland
